title: Safe Word: Jacquie Aiche Unveils New Timex Watch Collaboration
excerpt: Read our roundup of the best jewelry news, launches, and happenings this month to stay up to date on all things sparkly.
text: Jacquie Aiche and Timex Release New Summer-Ready Watch Collaboration Courtesy of Jacquie Aiche and TimexJewelry designer Jacquie Aiche has teamed up again with Timex to release a new collaboration—this time inspired by the desert sunset. Featuring pink and blue mother-of-pearl and a special watch dial design, the 36mm Desert Daze watch is meant to blend and stack with existing jewelry for an elevated boho wristscape. Jessica McCormack Opens Madison Avenue BoutiqueCourtesy of Jessica McCormackLondon-based jeweler Jessica McCormack has opened her third standalone store—her first in the U.S.—on Madison Avenue in New York City. Known for bold diamond designs, the brand finds its new home-away-from-home in over two floors of a Beaux-Arts building on the Upper East Side, restored and decorated with a multi-disciplinary art collection and a mix of antique and contemporary furniture. What’s more, the boutique will be supported by a local workshop, bringing the antique-inspired techniques directly to clients.Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowVan Cleef & Arpels Transforms New York City Into a Lush GardenCourtesy of Van Cleef & ArpelsSpring is in full bloom at Rockefeller Center’s Channel Gardens and Summer Rink, thanks to Van Cleef & Arpels. The renowned fine and high jewelry brand—celebrated for its nature-inspired, floral motifs—has teamed up with French artist Alexandre Benjamin Navet to transform the heart of the city into an interactive spring garden. Throughout the first three weekends of May, visitors can enjoy poetry readings, dance performances, and live painting sessions, all set amid Navet’s vibrant artistic installations.Fernando Jorge Debuts Roaring Twenties-Inspired Jewelry Collectioncourtesy of Fernando JorgeFine jewelry designer Fernando Jorge evokes the spirit of 1920s New York with his latest collection, Vertex, a tribute to the city’s iconic skyscrapers and the exuberance of the Jazz Age. Featuring striking baguette diamonds—a style that rose to prominence during that era—the collection channels a bygone time of opulence, celebration, and energy. The launch follows the February opening of Jorge’s New York salon and was marked with an intimate fête at Obvio, a newly opened hotspot in NoMad. Both the venue and the neighborhood perfectly mirror the glamour and architectural elegance of the new designs.Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowDavid Yurman Opens New Flagship in Miami’s Design DistrictCourtesy of David YurmanRenowned jewelry brand David Yurman has touched down in Miami’s Design District with a brand-new flagship store, designed in partnership with architect Andrea Tognon of Studio Tognon. The space is heavily inspired by the designer’s pieces, with arches created to mimic the natural curve of a his necklaces and stone finishes reminiscent of the precious stones used throughout his work. The iconic Cable design is present, too, with a sculpted handrail at the store entrance and circular vitrine underneath the staircase. Exclusive styles inspired by Miami’s vibrant spirit will be available to shop, with stones in bright pink, green, blue, and orange.
html:
Jacquie Aiche and Timex Release New Summer-Ready Watch Collaboration

Jewelry designer Jacquie Aiche has teamed up again with Timex to release a new collaboration—this time inspired by the desert sunset. Featuring pink and blue mother-of-pearl and a special watch dial design, the 36mm Desert Daze watch is meant to blend and stack with existing jewelry for an elevated boho wristscape.

Jessica McCormack Opens Madison Avenue Boutique

London-based jeweler Jessica McCormack has opened her third standalone store—her first in the U.S.—on Madison Avenue in New York City. Known for bold diamond designs, the brand finds its new home-away-from-home in over two floors of a Beaux-Arts building on the Upper East Side, restored and decorated with a multi-disciplinary art collection and a mix of antique and contemporary furniture. What’s more, the boutique will be supported by a local workshop, bringing the antique-inspired techniques directly to clients.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Van Cleef & Arpels Transforms New York City Into a Lush Garden

Spring is in full bloom at Rockefeller Center’s Channel Gardens and Summer Rink, thanks to Van Cleef & Arpels. The renowned fine and high jewelry brand—celebrated for its nature-inspired, floral motifs—has teamed up with French artist Alexandre Benjamin Navet to transform the heart of the city into an interactive spring garden. Throughout the first three weekends of May, visitors can enjoy poetry readings, dance performances, and live painting sessions, all set amid Navet’s vibrant artistic installations.

Fernando Jorge Debuts Roaring Twenties-Inspired Jewelry Collection

Fine jewelry designer Fernando Jorge evokes the spirit of 1920s New York with his latest collection, Vertex, a tribute to the city’s iconic skyscrapers and the exuberance of the Jazz Age. Featuring striking baguette diamonds—a style that rose to prominence during that era—the collection channels a bygone time of opulence, celebration, and energy. The launch follows the February opening of Jorge’s New York salon and was marked with an intimate fête at Obvio, a newly opened hotspot in NoMad. Both the venue and the neighborhood perfectly mirror the glamour and architectural elegance of the new designs.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

David Yurman Opens New Flagship in Miami’s Design District

Renowned jewelry brand David Yurman has touched down in Miami’s Design District with a brand-new flagship store, designed in partnership with architect Andrea Tognon of Studio Tognon. The space is heavily inspired by the designer’s pieces, with arches created to mimic the natural curve of a his necklaces and stone finishes reminiscent of the precious stones used throughout his work. The iconic Cable design is present, too, with a sculpted handrail at the store entrance and circular vitrine underneath the staircase. Exclusive styles inspired by Miami’s vibrant spirit will be available to shop, with stones in bright pink, green, blue, and orange.
